titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford University, Academic Council, Advisory Board Records
Stanford University, Academic Council, Advisory Board Records
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview

origination.label: Creator:
origination.corpname: Stanford University. Academic Council. Advisory Board.

did.unittitle: Stanford University, Academic Council, Advisory Board records
did.abstract: Minutes, memoranda, correspondence, reports, and other miscellaneous documents pertaining largely to faculty appointments and promotions in the university, including the Medical School, Law School, School of Education, Hopkins Marine Station, and the Graduate School of Business. Other issues the Board considered include academic organization and structures, policies regarding students (including the welfare of women students 1904-05), retirement and pension issues, and sabbatical leaves.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford University, Academic Council, Advisory Board Records (SC0665). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Advisory Board advises the President on recommendations for academic appointments, promotions, and dismissals; for the creation of new departments; for the abolition of departments; and any other matter that the President may choose to refer to it.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Minutes, memoranda, correspondence, reports, and other miscellaneous documents pertaining largely to faculty appointments and promotions in the university, including the Medical School, Law School, School of Education, Hopkins Marine Station, and the Graduate School of Business. Other issues the Board considered include academic organization and structures, policies regarding students (including the welfare of women students 1904-05), retirement and pension issues, and sabbatical leaves.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.corpname: Stanford University. Academic Council. Advisory Board.
controlaccess.subject: Women college students--California--Stanford.

scopecontent.p: Of note: recommendations for Dr. W. F. Durand, procedures on students delinquent in scholarship, salary guidelines, consolidation of departments
Of note: consolidation of departments, letters re Jean du Buy

did.unittitle: 1904 September – replies to Dr. Jordan's circular letter regarding salaries, etc.

scopecontent.p: Of note: report on art department by A. B. Clark, statement on new professorships needed, salaries, social policies for women students, recommendations for Harris J. Ryan and Henry W. Ballantine
Of note: number of women students and their welfare, appointment of Julius Hanna as stenographic assistant
Of note: formation of political science department, recommendations for Austin Flint Rogers and Payson J. Treat. [There are no papers relating to the Goebel case.]
Of note: procedures for removal of faculty, recommendations for C. H. Huberich and Elmer R. Drew, formation of political science department
Of note: recommendations for Leon P. Lewis and Henry David Gray
Of note: recommendations for John E. Goodwin, committees for control of athletic grounds
Of note: creation of new departments, report on work of the Board for 1904/05
Of note: Carnegie Pension Fund, recommendations for A. A. Young and E. W. Kemmerer, possible offer to Frederick Jackson Turner in History Department
Of note: recommendations for A. A. Young
Of note: letter from Jordan on limiting numbers of students admitted and raising standards, earthquake notice of April 19, Jordan's nomination of Thorstein B. Veblen

Of note: recommendations for John Crawford, response to Jordan's letter on limiting admissions, letter from E. P. Cubberley on work of School of Education in regard to certifying teachers, transfer of Cooper Medical College to Stanford
Of note: recommendations for Frederick A. Manchester, Carnegie Pension Fund
Of note: junior college concept, possibility of tuition charges, report on work of the board in 1905/06, retirement rules for faculty
Of note: recommendations for James M. Motley, Theodore W. Koch, George H. Sabine, Theodore De Laguna, and Henry W. Stuart
Of note: Law School appointments, appointment of university librarian, recommendations for Sidney Dean Townley
Of note: appointment of university librarian, recommendations for Frederick C. Woodward and D. O. McGovney, regulations for granting sabbatical leave
Of note: student fees, recommendation for Prof. Suzzallo and A. L. Guerard
Of note: military science courses and recommendations for Capt. U. G. McAlexander, regulations for leave of absence
Of note: student fees, rules for sabbatical leave
Of note: recommendations for Mrs. Evelyn Wight Allan (Dean of Women)
Of note: recommendations for Percy A. Martin, possible appointment of a Dean of Men, recommendation for Dr. Ram to teach class in Hebrew
Of note: transfer of Medical School and Medical School faculty
Of note: instruction in music courses
Of note: recommendation of Herbert F. Coolidge as Secretary to the Committee on Student Affairs and the issue of student discipline, nomination of Herbert C. Hoover as lecturer in mining
Of note: Jordan on desirability of Stanford representation at scholarly meetings, making department of law a graduate professional school
Of note: junior college issue, recommendations for W. H. Lewis, A. W. Meyer, Herbert E. Bolton, and Thomas A. Clark
Of note: recommendations for Thomas A. Clark and Edward B. Krehbiel, separation of the department of geology and mining
Of note: restoring title "Secretary of the University" for G. A. Clark, recommendation and appointment for Robert E. Pellissier
Of note: proposal for appointing Dr. Hersch Ram instructor in Semitic Languages (with funding from Rabbi Jacob Nieto)
Of note: abolishing associate professorship in Greek
Of note: status of Prof. H. W. Rolfe, retirement of Prof. M. B. Anderson,
Of note: recommendation of Aurelio Macedonio Espinoso
Of note: recommendations for E. E. Robinson, including medical professors in Academic Council
Of note: recommendation and appointment of Robert E. Pellissier
Of note: recommendations for Dr. Thomas Addis
Of note: recommendations for a variety of medical appointments
Of note: reorganization of Graphic Arts, possible appointment of Mr. Har Dayal to teach Indian philosophy, recommendations for Murray S. Wildman
Of note: legitimate uses of sabbatical leave, widow's pensions
Of note: Ernest B. Hoag's possible appointment in Education
Of note: possible elimination of Junior College work (i.e. freshman and sophomore year), letter of J. M. Stillman regarding faculty leave
Of note: research leave for faculty, widow's pensions, changing anatomy from a division to a department
Of note: anatomy department, letters of recommendation for Gottfried Hult and William H. Carruth
Of note: recommendations for Victor J. West and John William Davis
Of note: proposed consolidation of graphic arts with education
Of note: merging of department of English philology with English literature and rhetoric, recommendation for Ralph H. Lutz
Of note: recommendations for John S. P. Tatlock
Of note: nomination of Dr. Bailey Willis, recommendations for Charles Reining
Of note: appointment of Margery Bailey
Of note: Carnegie pension plan
Of note: major department system, reports from department heads about departmental requirements for the A.B. degree
Of note: plan for the organization of the School of Education
Of note: reports on the amalgamation of the departments of history, economics and political science and the creation of a School of Public Affairs, memoranda on political science by Victor J. West
Of note: memoranda on creating School of Public Affairs, recommendations for Reginald G. Trotter
Of note: possibility of limiting instructors to 5 years of service, sabbatical leave, question of intramural golf and tennis on Sundays
Of note: Report of the Sub-Committee of Advisory Board on Sabbatical Leave
Of note: creation of the Department of Classical Literature, report on establishment of School of Biology
Of note: proposal for granting honorary degrees
Of note: photos of Albert Haertlein with letter of recommendation
Of note: letters of recommendation for C. B. van Niel and Eugene L. Grant (includes photo of Grant)
Of note: H. F. Blichfeldt's letter re Henry Lanz; letters of recommendation for Henry Lang (Slavic languages) and James V. Uspensky (mathematics)
Of note: proposed articles of organization of the faculty of the school of medicine
Of note: letters of recommendation for Hugh Hildreth Skilling

Of note: H. F. Blichfeldt's endorsement of James V. Uspensky; annotated list of clinical appointments for the school of medicine; M. R. Kirkwood's proposal for changes in law degrees; letters of recommendation for Victor C. Twitty and Richard T. LaPiere
Of note: letters and proposal re authorizing a Bachelor of Arts degree in hygiene and physical education
Of note: recommendations for West lecturers
Of note: letters of recommendation for Bayard Quincy Morgan, Chilton R. Bush,
Of note: letter of recommendation for Paul R. Hanna with bibliography
Of note: letters re C. B. van Niel, record of work of James Percy Baumberger
Of note: memo re appointment of consulting professors in the GSB
Of note: career summaries for Profs. David Harris and Max Savelle (history dept.)
Of note: letters and c.v. for Stephen Timoshenko, letters of recommendation for George S. Myers (Natural History Museum)
Of note: letters re Victor C. Twitty
Of note: letters of recommendation for I. James Quillen
Of note: letters of recommendation for John Reid (philosophy)
Of note: recommendations and c.v.'s for F. E. Terman, Rolf. L. Bolin, Robert T. Ross, P. A. Leighton, P. J. van Rysselberghe
Of note: recommendations for Karl Spangenberg
Of note: recommendations and bibliographies for P. A. Leighton, George S. Parks, Alvin C. Eurich
